episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of quirky and intriguing topics, including the origins of the ball pit, superstitions surrounding bananas on fishing boats, the naming of the World Wide Web, and the first recorded use of the word "bellend" as an insult. The hosts delve into the history and peculiarities of each fact, providing humorous insights and anecdotes along the way.

facts.fact: The first ever ball pit was inspired by a jar of pickled onions.

Bananas are considered such bad luck on fishing boats that many captains ban anyone on board from wearing Banana Boat sunscreen or clothes made by the company Fruit of the Loom because their logo used to feature a banana.
Tim Berners-Lee originally wanted to call the World Wide Web the Information Mine, Tim, for short.
The first non-use of the word "bellend" to refer to a person was for the entire 1992 West Bromwich Albion football team.
